Draw a closed loop with the following curves and points: * Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.0) and ending at (0.75, 0.125) * Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.125) and ending at (0.25, 0.125) * Line 4: Starting at (0.25, 0.125) and ending at (0.0, 0.125) * Line 5: Starting at (0.0, 0.125) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) Generate Sketch for Face 2 Create another 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. Transform Sketches into 3D Transform both scaled 2D sketches into 3D sketches using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude Sketches Extrude the first sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal direction and do not extrude the second sketch. Save and Name the Part Save the final 3D model as "Part 1" with the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.3125 units (0.25 * 0.75 + 0.125 * 0.75) * Height: 0.375 units (0.125 + 0.25) The final shape should resemble a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces.</description>
